content.description: This is a good route as a scramble, mostly due to its position and views.  This is more of a hike than anything, but the final 30' are very cool and climb out and over onto a spire tip hanging several hundred feet above the canyon's floor.
content.protection: A rope if that is your gig, but the route is sufficiently safe as a scramble in approach shoes and doesn't really take gear anyway.
content.location: The route is found via swinging southeast around the end of the formation and then up to the West side of the South face and down into a notch.  From there the fun begins, onto and out the small twisted finger of rock over hundreds of feet, if not a thousand above the bottom of Bear Canyon.  To descend, climb back the way you came.
